datafield.subfield: Ibn ʻAṭāʼ Allāh, Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad,
Kitāb Laṭāʼif al-minan fī manāqib Abī al-ʻAbbās wa-shaykhih Abī al-Ḥasan,
Shelfmark: Ann Arbor, University of Michigan, Special Collections Research Center, Isl. Ms. 1029
Origin: Lacks dated colophon ; hand, paper, etc. would suggest late 16th or early 17th century.
Accompanying materials: Slip with notes in hand of Jameson [?] in pencil and red ink "MAKDISI – II | Laṭāʼif al-Matn | Keep this slip with book. 116 leaves | 21 1/2 cm."
Former shelfmark: Mich. Isl. Ms. temp. no. 178

Binding: Pasteboards covered in dark red-brown leather ; Type II binding (with flap, now lost) ; board linings in pink-tinted laid paper ; upper and lower covers carry blind-stamped mandorla (filled with vegetal composition reminiscent of Déroche. class. OAi2) and border in a series of blind rules ; sewn in cream thread, two stations, mainly broken, nearly all bifolia loose ; overall in poor condition with flap lost, significant pest damage, some abrasion, lifting and losses of leather, upper cover detaching, etc. ; housed in box for protection.

Support: European laid paper of at least two types ; one type with 8 laid lines per cm. (vertical), chain lines spaced 29 mm. apart (horizontal), and anchor in circle watermark with leaf above (see pp.3-4, 88-89, etc., roughly 70 mm. tall, compare no.125, etc. in Nikolaev, Watermarks of the Ottoman Empire, v.1) ; another type with 8 laid lines per cm. (vertical), chain lines spaced 25-27 mm. apart and anchor in circle watermark with trevoil above (60 mm. tall, see pp.28-29) ; countermarks include "Vd" (p.48) and "PS" (p.188) ; severe pest damage.
Decoration: Keywords and section headings rubricated ; textual dividers in the form of inverted commas in red.

Script: Naskh ; clear Egyptian hand in a medium line ; serifless with very slight effect of tilt to the left, pointing in distinct dots, alif maqṣūrah often pointed as yāʼ, the lām alif al-warrāqīyah used extensively, partially vocalized.
Layout: Written in 21 lines per page ; frame-ruled.

Collation: 11 V (110), III (116) ; almost exclusively quinions ; catchwords present ; foliation in pencil, Western numerals ; pagination in pencil, Western numerals, supplied during digitization (skips two pages between pp.15-16).
Explicit: "كذاك جميع من واليت فيكم ووالاني باجزال النصيب نجز الكتاب المبارك بحمد الله حق حمده وصلواته على سيدنا محمد واله وصحبه وسلم وحسبنا الله ونعم الوكيل ولا حول ولا قوة الا بالله العلي العظيم "

Incipit: "قال الشيخ الامام العالم العامل ... تاج الدين ابو العباس احمد بن الشيخ الامام العالم العامل مفتي المسلمين فخر الدين ابي بكر محمد بن الشيخ الفقيه الامام العالم العامل مفتي المسلمين رشيد الدين عبد الكريم بن عطا الله الاسكندري ... الحمد لله الذي فتح لاوليائه باب محبته وانشط نفوسهم من عقال القطعة ... اما بعد فاني قصدت في هذا الكتاب ان اذكر جملا من فضائل سيدنا ومولانا الامام قطب العارفين ... شهاب الدين ابو العباس احمد بن عمر الانصاري المرسي ... واذكر شيخه الذي اخذ عنه ومنازلاته التي نقلت عنه او سمعتها منه وكراماته وعلومه واسراره ومعاملاته مع الله سبحانه ... وما نقله عن شيخه الشيخ ابي الحسن الشاذلي ..."
Déroche, François, et al. Islamic Codicology: An Introduction to the Study of Manuscripts in Arabic Script. London: Al-Furqān Islamic Heritage Foundation, 2006.
Nikolaev, Vsevolod. Watermarks of the mediaeval Ottoman documents in Bulgarian libraries. In Watermarks of the Ottoman Empire, volume 1. Sofia: Bulgarian Academy of Sciences, 1954.
Mojtaba'i, Fathollah. "Abū al-ʻAbbās al-Mursī." In Encyclopaedia Islamica,

Fine copy of the treatise in ten bābs and a khātimah (comprised of al-Lāmiʻah al-munīrah wa-al-durrah al-khaṭīrah, al-Waṣīyah al-maktūb bihā ilá ikhwāninā bi-al-Iskandarīyah, and al-Qaṣīdah) on the lives and spiritual teachings of al-Shaykh Abū al-ʻAbbās al-Mursī (d.1287) and his shaykh, the founding shaykh of the Shādhilī ṭarīqah, Abū al-Ḥasan al-Shādhilī (d. 1258).
Purchased from Librairie Tunisienne by Mr. Sulaiman ;

Kabīkaj (here kaykataj) invocation "يا كيكتج احفظ من السوس" in Maghribī script on recto of opening leaf (p.1) ; assorted excerpts in Maghribī script on verso of opening leaf (p.2), final leaves and back flyleaf (p.226-229) ; former owners' marks on 'title page' (p.3) include small circular or oval seal impression (mainly effaced but likely reads "ما شاء الله لا قوة الا بالله," see Déroche et al, Islamic codicology, p.341 no.133 and compare instance in Sprenger 1056 Staatsbibliothek zu Berlin and others [contribution provided by Boris Liebrenz]), large oval seal impression (mainly effaced but likely reads "من متملكات الفقير عني الحاج مصطفى صدقي غفر له," in name of the Ottoman bibliophile Muṣṭafá Ṣidqī / d.1769 or 7, see Déroche et al, Islamic codicology, p.341 no.133 and compare instance in Sprenger 1056 Staatsbibliothek zu Berlin and others [contribution provided by Boris Liebrenz]), and ownership / purchase statement in name of Muḥammad al-Shādhilī ibn Maḥmūd ( محمد الشاذلي بن محمود ) ; UM Library inscription on p.5 "General Library | 623379-221 | Librairie Tunisienne | 5-12-67" ; marginal corrections.
Shādhilī, Abū al-Ḥasan ʻAlī ibn ʻAbd Allāh,
Abū al-ʻAbbās al-Mursī, Shihāb al-Dīn Aḥmad ibn ʻUmar,
كتاب لطائف المنن في مناقب ابي العباس وشيخه ابي الحسن,
ابن عطاء الله، أحمد بن محمد.
